meanings.definition: A person who cheats or swindles others.
meanings.sent1: The chiselers tricked people into giving them money.
meanings.sent2: Watch out for chiselers who try to take advantage of your trust.
meanings.sent3: The chiselers thought they could outsmart everyone, but they were caught in the end.
meanings.sent4: The chiselers were like sly foxes, always looking for an opportunity to deceive.
meanings.sent5: The image of the chiselers stayed in his mind, a reminder to be cautious.

meanings.sent1: They chiselers tried to chisel money out of unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to get chiseled by those who seek to deceive you.
meanings.sent3: The chiselers thought they could pull a fast one, but their plan backfired.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like chiselers, slowly eroding his trust.
meanings.sent5: The con artist chiselers his way into the hearts of the vulnerable.
